grid
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  grid.Grid
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGrid
public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGrid

A grid that consists of abstract squares.

Author:
Bavo Mees

size

public int size()
returns the number of squares in this grid. If the grid contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.

public ASquare getSquareAt(Coordinate coordinate)
Description copied from interface: IGrid

canMoveFromCoordInDirection

public boolean canMoveFromCoordInDirection(Coordinate fromCoord,
                                           Direction direction)
Description copied from interface: IGrid
Returns whether or not one is allowed to move one Square from a specified Coordinate in a specified Direction. One can only move to coordinates that exists on the grid (i.e. fromCoordinate.getCoordinateInDirection(direction) must exist on the grid). One cannot move through walls or light trails. No two players can be on the same Square.

Specified by:
canMoveFromCoordInDirection in interface IGrid
Parameters:
fromCoord - The coordinate one wants to leave.
direction - The direction one wants to move in.
Returns:
whether one is allowed to move one Square from a specified Coordinate in a specified Direction.

updatePowerFailures

public void updatePowerFailures()
This method updates all power failure related things. 
 - Current power failures will lose a TTL counter and be removed
   if it drops to zero
 - Each Square has a 5% chance to become power failured

addPowerFailureAtCoordinate

public void addPowerFailureAtCoordinate(Coordinate coordinate)
Add a power failure at a given coordinate. This method will also make sure the surrounding squares are power failured.

Parameters:
coordinate - The coordinate to receive the power failure.

enablePowerFailures

public void enablePowerFailures(boolean enabled)
Enable or disable power failures.

Parameters:
enabled - True if we want power failures in the game, false otherwise. By default, power failures will exist. This has been added for debugging purposes.
